newsitem.title: GERMANY: Fresenius Medical to issue $710 mln in debt, shares.
newsitem.headline: Fresenius Medical to issue $710 mln in debt, shares.

text.p: German medical group Fresenius Medical Care said on Tuesday it planned to issue $710 million in new preference shares and debt which will be used to pay back bank debts.
Fresenius Medical Care is the world's biggest dialysis group which was formed when Fresenius AG purchased National Medical Care Inc from U.S. group W.R. Grace & Co earlier this year.

In a mandatory statement Fresenius Medical said the new debt would be derived from subordinated debt worth about $360 million and from preference shares from its authorised capital, which is estimated to have an expected bourse value of $350 million.
Fresenius said the statement merely informed the public of its plans but did not represent an invitation to place interest to buy the new debt.
